subprocess_flow.description: Establish specific, measurable, achievable, relevant, and time-bound (SMART) data quality rules based on the defined data quality standards and data governance policies. These rules should cover various aspects of data quality, including accuracy, completeness, consistency, validity, and timeliness. Document these rules in a central repository for easy access and reference.
success_criteria: Definition of SMART data quality rules
Documentation of data quality rules in a central repository

subprocess_flow.description: Evaluate and select appropriate data quality tools to automate data quality checks and monitoring. Consider factors such as functionality, scalability, integration capabilities, and cost. The selected tools should support data profiling, data validation, data cleansing, and data monitoring. Ensure that the tools are compatible with the existing data infrastructure and workflows.
outputs: List of selected data quality tools
success_criteria: Selection of appropriate data quality tools
Compatibility of tools with existing data infrastructure

subprocess_flow.description: Configure the selected data quality tools to implement the defined data quality rules. This involves setting up automated data quality checks within data pipelines and workflows. Ensure that the checks are comprehensive and cover all critical data elements. Define thresholds for data quality metrics and configure alerts to be triggered when these thresholds are exceeded.
inputs: List of selected data quality tools
success_criteria: Implementation of automated data quality checks
Configuration of alerts for data quality issues

subprocess_flow.description: Create data quality dashboards to monitor data quality metrics and trends. These dashboards should provide a visual representation of data quality scores, compliance rates, and other relevant metrics. Ensure that the dashboards are user-friendly and provide insights into potential data quality issues. Make the dashboards accessible to relevant stakeholders, including data owners, data stewards, and the Data Governance Team.
success_criteria: Development of user-friendly data quality dashboards
Accessibility of dashboards to relevant stakeholders

subprocess_flow.description: Define a clear process for identifying, investigating, and resolving data quality issues. This process should include roles and responsibilities for issue resolution, escalation procedures, and timelines for resolution. Document the issue resolution process and communicate it to all relevant stakeholders. Ensure that the process is integrated with the data quality monitoring dashboards and alerts.
success_criteria: Documentation of data quality issue resolution process
Integration of issue resolution process with data quality monitoring
